contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== <gallery> Image:Haymarketstation.jpg|Haymarket Station Image:Battle tewkesbury.JPG|Battle of Tewkesbury Image:William Walker by Brady.jpg|William Walker Image:WilliamWalker cropped.jpg|William Walker File:May Fourth.jpg|May Fourth Movement File:Margaret Thatcher cropped2.png|Margaret Thatcher </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | '''[[Remembrance of the Dead]]''' in the [[Netherlands]] | bare URLs |- | '''[[Greenery Day]]''' in [[Japan]] | refimprove |- | [[1471]] – [[Wars of the Roses]]: [[House of York|Yorkist]] [[Edward IV of England|Edward IV]] defeated a [[House of Lancaster|Lancastrian army]] in the '''[[Battle of Tewkesbury]]'''. | unreferenced section |- | [[1910]] – The '''[[Royal Canadian Navy]]''' was created as the ''Naval Service of Canada''. | unreferenced section |- |[[1919]] – The '''[[May Fourth Movement]]''' began in China with large-scale student demonstrations in [[Tiananmen Square]], [[Beijing|Peking]], against the [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]] and Japan's ''[[Twenty-One Demands]]''. |unreferenced section |- |[[1949]] – A plane carrying almost the entire [[Torino A.C.]] [[Association football|football]] team '''[[Superga air disaster|crashed]]''' into the hill of [[Superga]] near [[Turin]], Italy, killing all 31 aboard including 18 players, club officials, and the journalists accompanying them. |refimprove |- |[[1996]] – '''[[José María Aznar]]''' was [[Spanish general election, 1996|elected]] [[List of Prime Ministers of Spain|Prime Minister of Spain]], ending 13 years of [[Spanish Socialist Workers' Party|Socialist]] rule. |refimprove section |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1493]] – [[Pope Alexander VI]] issued the [[papal bull]] '''''[[Inter caetera]]''''', establishing a line of demarcation dividing the New World between Spain and Portugal. {{*mp}} [[1814]] – [[Ferdinand VII of Spain|Ferdinand VII]] abolished the '''[[Spanish Constitution of 1812]]''', returning Spain to [[absolute monarchy|absolutism]]. {{*mp}} [[1886]] – An unknown assailant threw a bomb into a crowd of police, turning a peaceful [[Labor movement|labor rally]] in [[Chicago]] into the '''[[Haymarket affair|Haymarket massacre]]''', which resulted in the deaths of seven police officers and many bystanders. {{*mp}} [[1942]] – [[World War II]]: The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] engaged [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] naval forces at the '''[[Battle of the Coral Sea]]''', the first fleet action in which [[aircraft carrier]]s engaged each other. {{*mp}} [[1970]] – The [[Ohio]] [[United States National Guard|National Guard]] '''[[Kent State shootings|opened fire]]''' at [[Kent State University]] students [[protest]]ing the [[Cambodian Campaign|United States invasion]] of [[Cambodia]], killing four and injuring nine. {{*mp}} [[1979]] – '''[[Margaret Thatcher]]''' became the first female [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]], following the defeat of [[James Callaghan]]'s incumbent [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] government in the previous day's [[United Kingdom general election, 1979|general election]]. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[May 4]]''': '''[[Holy Saturday]]''' (Eastern Christianity, 2013); '''[[Star Wars Day|''Star Wars'' Day]]''' <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:Sunrise, Manaslu.jpg|Sunrise, Manaslu|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1436]] – Swedish rebel and later [[folk hero|national hero]] '''[[Engelbrekt Engelbrektsson]]''' was assassinated in the midst of the [[Engelbrekt rebellion]]. {{*mp}} [[1836]] – The '''[[Ancient Order of Hibernians]]''', an [[Irish Catholic]] [[fraternal organization]], was founded in [[New York City]]. {{*mp}} [[1959]] – The [[1959 Grammy Awards|inaugural]]<!--not bold, refimprove--> '''[[Grammy Awards]]''' ceremony was held, recognizing outstanding achievement in the American [[music industry]]. {{*mp}} [[1974]] – An all-female Japanese team reached the summit of '''[[Manaslu]]''' ''(pictured)'' in the [[Himalayas]], becoming the first women to climb an [[Eight-thousander|8,000-meter peak]]. {{*mp}} [[1982]] – [[Falklands War]]: '''{{HMS|Sheffield|D80|6}}''' was struck by an [[Exocet]] missile, killing 20 sailors and leading to its sinking six days later—the first [[Royal Navy]] ship sunk in action since World War II. {{*mp}} [[1990]] – The [[Supreme Council of the Republic of Latvia|Supreme Soviet of the Latvian SSR]] declared '''[[On the Restoration of Independence of the Republic of Latvia|the restoration of independence of Latvia]]''', stating that the [[Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact]] and the [[Soviet occupation of Latvia in 1940]] were illegal. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=May|Day=4}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
